Title: Gradation
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Gradation (climax) is an arrangement of sentences which features a gradual increase of significance or importance. Each successive unit has to be stronger than the preceding one.

example:

  • It was a lovely city, a beautiful city, a fair city, a veritable gem of a city.
